metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5884 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
gtk-vnc before 0.7.0 does not properly check boundaries ofsubrectangle-containing tiles, which allows remote servers to executearbitrary code via the src x, y coordinates in a crafted (1) rre, (2)hextile, or (3) copyrect tile.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5884` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gtk-vnc-2.0 - 0.5.3-1.3ubuntu2.1
gvncviewer - 0.5.3-1.3ubuntu2.1
libgtk-vnc-1.0-0 - 0.5.3-1.3ubuntu2.1
libgtk-vnc-2.0-0 - 0.5.3-1.3ubuntu2.1
libgvnc-1.0-0 - 0.5.3-1.3ubuntu2.1
python-gtk-vnc - 0.5.3-1.3ubuntu2.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: gtk-vnc package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.5.3-1.3ubuntu2.1').
